column4: see the thing is, when i install the proprietary drivers for my laptop, restarting would just give me a boot hang and i wouldnt know what to do after
does anyone else encounter that problem?
and im talking about the proprietary drivers for the graphics card
what part of the boot sequence does it hang?
basically after i choose which kernal to run, it just stays black
yeah...that's not good
none of the kernal options work, jeangray?
mondota: from the last time i remember, not even the recovery loaded
and this started after installing new drivers?
yes
and, i have to ask, you're sure you got software from a trusted source?
im downloaiding it right off the additional drivers from ubuntu
i hope thats trusted
well that's weird then. ubuntu repos should be pretty safe
well im going to try installing the one from the amd graphics website
ill see what happens
but i've also heard of boot-sector viruses, especially today in my own troubleshooting
boot-sector virsues?
yeah, proprietary is okay to try too.
i've got a laptop that won't boot HDD, and that was one cause tossed around in old forum posts
oh okay, yeahwell ill come back and hopefully everything will be working, thank you for your help
no problem. good luck and everything
